lines.text: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS and SIMPLE

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: I pray you now, good master Slender's serving-man, and friend Simple by your name, which way have you looked for Master Caius, that calls himself doctor of physic?

lines.speaker: simple
lines.text: Marry, sir, the pittie-ward, the park-ward, every way; old Windsor way, and every way but the town way.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: I most fehemently desire you you will also look that way.

lines.speaker: simple
lines.text: I will, sir.
Exit

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: 'Pless my soul, how full of chollors I am, and trempling of mind! I shall be glad if he have deceived me. How melancholies I am! I will knog his urinals about his knave's costard when I have good opportunities for the ork. 'Pless my soul! To shallow rivers, to whose falls Melodious birds sings madrigals; There will we make our peds of roses, And a thousand fragrant posies. To shallow-- Mercy on me! I have a great dispositions to cry. Melodious birds sing madrigals-- When as I sat in Pabylon-- And a thousand vagram posies. To shallow  and c.
Sings
Sings
Re-enter SIMPLE

lines.speaker: simple
lines.text: Yonder he is coming, this way, Sir Hugh.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: He's welcome. To shallow rivers, to whose falls- Heaven prosper the right! What weapons is he?
Sings

lines.speaker: simple
lines.text: No weapons, sir. There comes my master, Master Shallow, and another gentleman, from Frogmore, over the stile, this way.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Pray you, give me my gown; or else keep it in your arms.
Enter PAGE, SHALLOW, and SLENDER

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: How now, master Parson! Good morrow, good Sir Hugh. Keep a gamester from the dice, and a good student from his book, and it is wonderful.

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: [Aside]  Ah, sweet Anne Page!

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: 'Save you, good Sir Hugh!

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: 'Pless you from his mercy sake, all of you!

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: What, the sword and the word! do you study them both, master parson?

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: And youthful still! in your doublet and hose this raw rheumatic day!

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: There is reasons and causes for it.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: We are come to you to do a good office, master parson.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Fery well: what is it?

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Yonder is a most reverend gentleman, who, belike having received wrong by some person, is at most odds with his own gravity and patience that ever you saw.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: I have lived fourscore years and upward; I never heard a man of his place, gravity and learning, so wide of his own respect.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: What is he?

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: I think you know him; Master Doctor Caius, the renowned French physician.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Got's will, and his passion of my heart! I had as lief you would tell me of a mess of porridge.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: He has no more knowledge in Hibocrates and Galen, --and he is a knave besides; a cowardly knave as you would desires to be acquainted withal.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: I warrant you, he's the man should fight with him.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: [Aside]  O sweet Anne Page! It appears so by his weapons. Keep them asunder: here comes Doctor Caius.
Enter Host, DOCTOR CAIUS, and RUGBY

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Nay, good master parson, keep in your weapon.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: So do you, good master doctor.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Disarm them, and let them question: let them keep their limbs whole and hack our English.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: I pray you, let-a me speak a word with your ear. Vherefore vill you not meet-a me?

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: [Aside to DOCTOR CAIUS]  Pray you, use your patience: in good time.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, you are de coward, de Jack dog, John ape.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: [Aside to DOCTOR CAIUS]  Pray you let us not be laughing-stocks to other men's humours; I desire you in friendship, and I will one way or other make you amends. I will knog your urinals about your knave's cockscomb for missing your meetings and appointments.
Aloud

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Diable! Jack Rugby,--mine host de Jarteer,--have I not stay for him to kill him? have I not, at de place I did appoint?

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: As I am a Christians soul now, look you, this is the place appointed: I'll be judgement by mine host of the Garter.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Peace, I say, Gallia and Gaul, French and Welsh, soul-curer and body-curer!

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Ay, dat is very good; excellent.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Peace, I say! hear mine host of the Garter. Am I politic? am I subtle? am I a Machiavel? Shall I lose my doctor? no; he gives me the potions and the motions. Shall I lose my parson, my priest, my Sir Hugh? no; he gives me the proverbs and the no-verbs. Give me thy hand, terrestrial; so. Give me thy hand, celestial; so. Boys of art, I have deceived you both; I have directed you to wrong places: your hearts are mighty, your skins are whole, and let burnt sack be the issue. Come, lay their swords to pawn. Follow me, lads of peace; follow, follow, follow.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: Trust me, a mad host. Follow, gentlemen, follow.

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: [Aside]  O sweet Anne Page!
Exeunt SHALLOW, SLENDER, PAGE, and Host

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Ha, do I perceive dat? have you make-a de sot of us, ha, ha?

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: This is well; he has made us his vlouting-stog. I desire you that we may be friends; and let us knog our prains together to be revenge on this same scall, scurvy cogging companion, the host of the Garter.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, with all my heart. He promise to bring me where is Anne Page; by gar, he deceive me too.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Well, I will smite his noddles. Pray you, follow.
Exeunt
